topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Deploying the ESX Compute Proxy

body.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade vCenter ESX compute proxy (compute proxy) is a driver that enables the Compute service to communicate with a VMware vCenter server managing one or more ESX hosts. The HP Helion OpenStack Compute Service (Nova) requires this driver to interface with VMware ESX hypervisor APIs.

After installing and configuring the VMware ESX and vCenter Server, use the following instructions to install the compute proxy. The compute proxy is distributed as open virtual appliance (OVA) template file. The compute proxy template needs to be available in the vCenter before the deploying the HP Helion OpenStack cloud (before you run hprovision script).
The ESX and vCenter server should be installed within the non-KVM region and attached to the CLM network, as shown in the Technical Overview
The process for installing the compute proxy includes the following:

section.title: Dowloading the compute proxy
section.p: The required ESX Compute Center Proxy template is included in the hcg_1.1.0.tar you downloaded in the Prerequisites. Move the template file, named TEMPL-CPV9.ova to the server where vCenter is installed, or a system you can access from the vCenter server. If you need to download the template again:

ol.li:
In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
On the Downloads page, locate Helion Carrier Grade 1.1.0 and click Download.
Download the Checksum and Signature files. Refer to the Prerequisites for information on verifying the download signature and verifying the download checksums.
Extract the TEMPL-CPV9.ova file to any local directory. Note the location of the extracted file.

section.title: Deploy the compute proxy on the ESX Host
section.p:
To deploy the compute proxy:
Launch the VMware vCenter client.
Click File, then Deploy OVF Template.
In the Deploy OVF Template wizard, specify the location of the TEMPL-CPV9.ova file.
Click Next and complete the wizard.

section.title: Modify esx.json
section.p: When you provision HP Helion OpenStack during the installation, the hprovision script provisions the compute proxy based on the details specified in the esx.json file.

You need to modify the esx.json file with values appropriate for your environment. You can use the CLM network details from the environment.json file. The compute proxy nodes will be assigned a static IP address based on the cidr calculation.
See Sample esx.json file for details on modifying the esx.json file.

section.title: Integration into the cloud framework
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation scripts will perform the tasks required to integrate the compute proxy into the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud.
For example, the hprovision script provisions the compute proxy node(s) and appends the provisioned proxy nodes to the nodes.json file.

Since the compute proxy nodes are listed in the nodes.json file, they are recognized by the hcfgproc script and required metadata is generated for these nodes. Further the hnetinit script sets the appropriate networking and updates hosts file on these nodes to be configured by the hdeploy process.
